subject: Real Estate
title: Quantitative Easing and Property Prices
description: A fast breakdown of Quantitative Easing and Property Prices for builders.

hook.text: After 2008, the Federal Reserve printed $4.5 trillion and used it to buy bonds. Asset prices soared.

buildup.text: Quantitative easing pushed interest rates to historic lows, making mortgages cheaper than ever.

discovery.text: Cheap mortgages reignited housing demand. By 2020, U.S. home prices had fully recovered and then some.

twist.text: Critics argue QE rescued asset owners â€” homeowners and investors â€” while renters were left behind.

climax.text: QE saved the economy but widened the wealth gap between those who owned property and those who didn't.

punchline.text: Printing money saved homeowners and punished renters.

quiz.question: How did quantitative easing affect home prices?
options: Low rates drove prices back up
